intro: Melilotoides cachemiriana, commonly known as the Kashmir melilot, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
